name: Make a Payment
description: Caller wants to pay a premium, catch up on overdue balance, or set up auto-pay/EFT/bank draft for recurring payments.
examples: Sandra Haymore wants to make a payment for her automobile insurance policy, specifically the monthly installment.
Hannah wants to set up automatic payments for her insurance policies, provide her bank routing and account numbers
The caller wanted to make a down payment on their Progressive auto insurance policy and confirm the payment details.

name: Billing Question / Dispute
description: Caller is confused about a charge, unexpected amount, payment status, premium discrepancy, duplicate charge, or refund. Not trying to pay — wants an explanation.
examples: Aurelio Garcia is questioning a $2,000 business insurance bill from Amtras/Travelers, claiming it was unexpected
Victor Santiago is seeking clarification about an unexpected $3,500 charge on his card, which he believes was incorrectly processed by autopay
The caller is seeking clarification on her calculated insurance premium ($479) vs the amounts quoted by an agent ($542.20)

name: New Insurance Quote
description: Caller shopping for new insurance coverage (auto, home, commercial, renters, life, specialty). Includes quote follow-ups checking on previously requested quotes.
examples: Karen Abruzo seeks a home insurance quote, believing her current Geico rate may be too high
Kendrick Cabrera is seeking general liability and workers' compensation insurance for his new construction company
The caller is seeking a liability insurance quote for a moped.

name: Vehicle Add/Remove/Replace
description: Caller wants to add a newly purchased vehicle, remove a sold/totaled vehicle, or swap vehicles on their auto policy.
examples: Angela Fulton wants to add a car to her existing personal car insurance policy.
The caller wants to add a newly purchased 2025 Toyota RAV4 to their existing insurance policy
The caller wants to remove a 2012 Nissan Altima from their insurance policy and confirm the effective date of removal.

name: Driver Add/Remove
description: Caller wants to add a driver (new teen, spouse, household member) or remove a driver from their policy.
examples: Melissa Nelson wants to add her daughter as a driver to her existing insurance policy after the daughter obtains her full license
The caller asked whether they need to add a young person to their insurance policy to obtain a learner's permit.
James Marshall wants to update his Progressive umbrella policy to remove his daughter after she moved to Ohio

name: Coverage Modification
description: Caller wants to change deductibles, add/remove coverage types (collision, comprehensive, towing, umbrella, etc.), or adjust liability limits on existing policy.
examples: Melissa Lail wants to change her insurance policy's deductible to $1,000
Cheryl Dickerson is following up on increasing her umbrella insurance policy from $1 million to $2 million
Jean wants to adjust their boat insurance to remove unnecessary coverages while retaining collision and liability

name: Policy Cancellation
description: Caller explicitly wants to cancel one or more policies due to selling property, switching carriers, business closure, relocation, or dissatisfaction.
examples: Pat Littleton wants to cancel his business owner policy effective September 15th because he is selling his embroidery business
Henry wants to cancel his home and auto insurance policies because he found a better rate
Juan wants to cancel his workers' compensation and general liability insurance policies because he is no longer working as an installer

name: Policy Reinstatement
description: A policy was canceled (usually for non-payment) and the caller wants it reinstated. Often urgent, involves reinstatement windows and past-due payment.
examples: Barry Vernon is seeking assistance to resolve a canceled Travelers auto insurance policy due to non-payment
David Malia wants to reinstate his canceled insurance policy after non-renewal due to missed payment.
Jamie seeks to reinstate a canceled workers' comp policy affected by a hacked debit card

name: Claims Filing & Follow-Up
description: Caller reporting a new claim (accident, theft, property damage, weather) or following up on an existing claim's status, settlement, adjuster communication, or payment.
examples: Tim Holt is reporting a truck accident involving his 2021 Ram at 6:00 AM in Rocky Mountain, NC
Stephen Leak is reporting a stolen toolbox valued at $4,000-$5,000 from his truck
The caller wants to resolve a car damage claim settlement delayed by an unresponsive adjuster

name: Policy Renewal / Rate Review
description: Existing customer reviewing upcoming renewal, understanding rate changes, comparing carriers, exploring bundling discounts, or asking why their rate went up.
examples: Charles is concerned about a significant increase in his insurance premiums (auto up $600/year, home up $173/year)
Corbin is checking if his insurance policies (auto and homeowners) are still the best option
Savannah King is seeking clarification on a significant increase in her Progressive insurance renewal premium

name: Certificate of Insurance (COI)
description: Caller needs a certificate of insurance generated, corrected, or sent to a third party (builder, lender, vendor, general contractor).
examples: Chris from Conterra Marble and Granite requests a certificate of insurance for Perrier Builders
Jason Harkey is requesting a corrected COI for FCR Holdings LLC, ensuring it includes 'DBA First Class Roofing'
Donnie from MPE Rentals needs an updated certificate of insurance reflecting $80,000 coverage for rented/leased equipment

name: Document Request
description: Caller needs a copy of their policy, declaration page, proof of insurance, ID cards, loss runs, or bond copy. Often time-sensitive for closings, dealerships, or lenders.
examples: The caller requested a copy of his current insurance policy be emailed to him as proof of insurance
Vicky Hill needs a copy of her insurance declaration page for her employer
Tequisha requested a loss run report for Chris's Auto Company LLC

name: DMV / Compliance
description: Caller received a DMV notice about plate revocation, needs an FS-1 form filed, or has a compliance issue where DMV believes coverage lapsed. Includes DOT number setup.
examples: Casey Tuttle is seeking clarification about an FS-1 form related to a DMV notice and vehicle registration revocation
Joseph Fernandez needs assistance addressing a DMV letter regarding an alleged insurance lapse and submitting an FS1 form
Sunny is assisting Cody in navigating the process of setting up a DOT number

name: Mortgage / Lender Coordination
description: Calls involving escrow payment issues, mortgage company needing proof of insurance, lienholder additions/removals, or resolving discrepancies between insurer and mortgage servicer.
examples: Linda Ashford is seeking clarification about an unexpected increase in her home insurance escrow amount
Gary contacted Alliance Insurance to resolve an issue where his mortgage company had not received his updated policy
Matthew from NewRes is confirming whether NewRes LLC is listed as a mortgagee on Francisco Flores' policy

name: Workers' Comp Administration
description: Calls about workers' comp audits, class codes, payroll reporting, ghost policies, audit collections, and WC claims. Specialized knowledge domain.
examples: Lily is seeking assistance with an unexpected charge from Travelers due to an audit on a canceled workers' comp policy
Victor Santiago needs assistance completing a Workers Comp policy audit for Travelers, which is currently non-compliant
Donette Sikes needs assistance changing workers' comp class codes from 8848 to 8826/8824 after an audit

name: Policy Info Update
description: Caller needs to update address, phone, email, name (divorce/marriage), DBA, or payment method on their policy. Administrative changes only.
examples: Justin Horn wants to update his address on file with Alliance Insurance
Andrea wants to change her last name on her home insurance policy post-divorce
Agent Jamie is assisting client Mary with updating Jocelyn Harris's email address on her Auto Owners account

name: Coverage Question / Clarification
description: Caller asks 'am I covered for X?' without requesting changes. Pure knowledge query about what their policy covers or excludes.
examples: The caller is inquiring about coverage for damages caused by a fallen tree limb that disrupted power lines
Eric Leopold is following up on whether his commercial policy covers lawsuits related to GPS tracking
Pam is seeking clarification on towing coverage differences between her current policy and Auto Owners

name: Commercial / Specialty Inquiry
description: Complex commercial questions requiring specialized underwriting judgment — builder's risk, vacant property, bonds, HOA, church programs, dealer lots, special events, liquor liability, farm, life/health.
examples: Todd Fry is asking whether a builder's risk policy covers theft of materials on a construction site
Bruce Murray seeks advice on insuring his wife's church-affiliated preschool
Salman is seeking auto dealer insurance for a new used car sales business in Charlotte, NC

name: Follow-Up / Status Check
description: Caller checking on a pending quote, document, payment, policy change, or any prior request that hasn't been completed yet.
examples: Oscar is following up on submitted insurance quotes that are pending approval
Victoria is following up on a previous conversation to check the status of an insurance quote
Nathan Bell wanted to confirm receipt of a proposal email sent for carrier renewal confirmation

name: Routing / Triage
description: Calls primarily about reaching a specific agent, returning a voicemail, language assistance (Spanish), non-insurance matters (IT, personal), courtesy calls, or vendor solicitation.
examples: The caller wanted to speak with Holly Moore at Alliance Insurance but was informed she was unavailable
The caller requested assistance in Spanish, which was not available, and agreed to a callback on Monday.
Ashley wanted to place an order for a side of hibachi chicken.
